content:
I was going to install HAX to test it out and it looks like both Webcomponents and HAX are pointing to old/outdated releases:

  • https://backdropcms.org/project/hax
  • https://backdropcms.org/project/webcomponents
@klonos @BWPanda :wait_one_second:
I wonder how we can fix this. I'd imagine the most recent official release should just automatically be selected, shouldn't it?

If we don't solve this before tomorrow night. We can talk about it at:
https://backdrop-live.backdropcms.org/session/hax-the-backdrop-cms
Atten: @Bryan Ollendyke
Yes, not sure if I can make the time of the session but am interested and if recorded will definitely watch. I added a few issues to those modules (HAX, Webcomponents).
But in this case I was referring to solving the broader recurring issue of old releases continuing to be served by Project Installer.

I'm probably not going to make the session either (due to a schedule conflict), but I would like to know how HAX and structured data can work together. AFAICT, HAX is like Gutenberg, in that everything (data and markup) is stored in the node body, so that it is impossible to have views and layouts based on fields. So far, that is my primary reason for not using it.
I have the same impression @oadaeh (Jason Flatt) (not sure if it is correct though).

@klonos or @BWPanda Could you update the recommended release for Menu Views?
https://backdropcms.org/project/menu_views
